title: Rodley Nature Reserve Walks

images.title: Entrance to Rodley Nature Reserve - off Town Street by Betty Longbottom, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Entrance to Rodley Nature Reserve

images.title: John Seb Barber from Leeds, UK, CC BY 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
michael ely / Hide, Rodley Nature Reserve
images.caption: Hide. The reserve is a wetland area built on a former sewage works on the banks of the River Aire. It is supported, amongst other organizations, by The Wildfowl and Wetland Trust.

images.title: Mark Stevenson, CC BY 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Leeds And Liverpool Canal

description: This walk explores the Rodley Nature Reserve in Leeds. The wildlife rich reserve is located a few miles west of the city on the River Aire. The wetland area is a great place for bird spotting with several species of migrating waders and wildfowl to look out for from the on site hides. There's nice river paths and the option of continuing your waterside walking along the Leeds and Liverpool Canal. You can follow the Leeds Canal Walk to the reserve from the city and then continue east to visit the historic Kirkstall Abbey. The peaceful woodland trails at Calverley Woods are located just to the west.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: There is a decent on site visitor centre with a cafe selling a range of refreshments.

display_address: Newlaithes Road, Low Fold, Horsforth Vale, Horsforth, West Yorkshire, England, LS18 4SY, United Kingdom
